div.class: hide-for-small medium-3 large-3 columns three navlinks

span.p: To register a new kindergartner for the 2020-2021 school year, please visit this link.

If you already have a student at Jackson-Milton and already have a Final Forms account as a parent, log in with that account. Much of the forms for your new kindergartner will already be filled out for you.
If you and your kindergartner are both new to Jackson-Milton (WELCOME!), click the blue "New Account" button to create a parent account and register your child.

a.title: Click to read more about: Online Kindergarten Registration (2020-2021)

div.a: Jackson-Milton High School Named 2020 Best High School

span.p: U.S. News & World Report, the global authority in rankings and consumer advice, today revealed the 2020 Best High Schools, and Jackson-Milton High School is a 2020 Best High School, based on the rankings. Here is our school's updated U.S. News profile page, with its new National, metro-area, and school-district rankings.

a.title: Click to read more about: Jackson-Milton High School Named 2020 Best High School

div.a: ...Read More about Jackson-Milton High School Named 2020 Best High School
Application for Free & Reduced Meals (COVID19 pandemic)

a.title: Click to read more about: Application for Free & Reduced Meals (COVID19 pandemic)

div.a: ...Read More about Application for Free & Reduced Meals (COVID19 pandemic)

span.b: The Jackson-Milton School District appreciates your patience and understanding as we navigate together through this unprecedented time. Governor DeWine has extended the state wide closure of public schools until May 1, 2020. Please know this could be extended further, but if it is not extended, school will resume Monday, May 4, 2020. We know families have a lot of questions, and we want to address these questions to the best of our ability, but please know plans and dates are subject to change. As a reminder, please contact teachers directly through email with any questions regarding class assignments. Teachers are checking their emails. It is also important that students check their school email and login to online classes.

a.title: Click to read more about: Updated District Communication: April 7, 2020
